data.prayer: Spirit, protect the overcomers in Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bangladesh, so that they will one day sit with Jesus on His throne.
data.verse: He who overcomes, I will give to him to sit down with me on my throne, as I also overcame, and sat down with my Father on his throne.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bangladesh
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, please help the 3,746 believers in the county of Dinajpur to be filled with joyful obedience at all times, as you modeled for us all.
Over 99.57 percent of the people of Dinajpur are far from Jesus.
Father, as people seek answers on the internet, please help them find the gospel in Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bangladesh.
data.verse: So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

data.prayer: Lord God, I thank you that the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without defect to God, can cleanse the Rajwar people conscience from dead works to serve the living God.
Father, for those in trouble in the county of Dinajpur prompt them to call on you for rescue today.
data.verse: He will call on me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.

data.prayer: Jesus, please give the apostles in Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bangladesh a vision for the harvest, and a passion to see the gospel spread to every corner of the the county.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Father, make bold the prophets in Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bangladesh so that the church can be equipped with truth and insight and a vision of your heart.
data.verse: These are the things which you should do: speak the truth to one another; judge with truth and judgment for peace in your gates.

location.name: Dinajpur
location.people_groups_list: Rajput (Hindu traditions), Aguri, Dai (Muslim traditions), Paliya, Rajbansi Pali (Hindu traditions)
